source.name: Wikipedia
source.title: List of gairaigo and wasei-eigo terms

words: From the English |after service|: customer service, user support, after care, service
From the English |idol|: (teen) idol, pop star
From the English/German |ice/Eis|: ice, also used as a shortened form of ice cream
From the English |ice cream|: ice cream
From the German |(Steig)eisen (meaning 'climbing iron' or 'crampon')|: crampons
From the English |Ame(rican) foot(ball)|: American football
From the English |American dog|: corn dog
From the English |anima(tion)|: animation, animated cartoons or films
From the English |ani(me) + son(g)|: an anime song, most often the theme
From the English |answer|: reply to a question, solution to a problem
From the American English |apart(ment)|: though usually in small two-story wood-structure buildings, not multistory complexes as in the US usage
アルバイト or バイト
From the English |RV|: truck, van, SUV, Recreational Vehicle
From the Dutch |alcohol, álcool|: alcohol, alcoholic beverage
From the English |bargain|: a sale at a store
From the English |bike|: a motorcycle, but not a bicycle
From the English |book cover|: dust jacket
From the English |back mirror|: rear-view mirror
From the English |back number|: back issue
From the English |back net|: a backstop (in baseball)
From the English |barrier free|: Accessible facilities for handicapped persons
From the French |Bariquand et Marre|: Hand or electric operating hair trimmer
From the English |butter|: butter, sometimes used on food packaging to refer to margarine
From the English |baby car|: stroller (US), pushchair or pram (UK)
From the English |bed town|: bedroom suburbs, bedroom community, dormitory suburb, commuter town
From the English |business hotel|: budget hotel
From the English |buil(ding)|: building (especially modern steel / concrete buildings)
From the German |Bombe|: a steel canister for storing pressurized gas, such as a propane tank
From the English |ball(point) pen|: a ballpoint pen
From the English |blazer|: blazer, or a Japanese school uniform that includes that garment
From the English |bloomers|: short pants worn for exercise by girls, usually in PE class in high school
キャビンアテンダント
From the English |Cabin attendant|: A flight attendant
From the English |cherry boy|: A male virgin
From the English |Collab(orations)|: A term for when two separate entities come together and make something
From the English |dump car|: dump truck (US), dumper (UK)
From the English |dust box|: rubbish bin (UK), garbage can (US)
ダウンロードオンリーメンバー
From the English |download only member|: a computing leech
From the English |dead ball|: hit by a pitch
デコレーションケーキ
From the English |decoration cake|: a fancy cake
From the English |depart(ment store)|: department store
From the English |delivery health|: a form of prostitution, essentially a call girl or escort service
From the English |desk|: an editor for a certain section of a publication, as in "the sports desk"
ドクター ストップ
From the English |doctor stop|: when the doctor tells a patient to stop doing something
From the English |don('t) mi(nd)|: "don't worry about it", "don't pay (that) any mind", "it's/I'm OK", "no problem". Frequently used when something goes wrong
From the English |driver|: a screwdriver, motor vehicle driver
From the English |drive in|: rest area, motor lodge, drive-in
From the English |drama|: TV drama, soap opera
From the English |drift|: drifting, in the sense of a car in the controlled skid used in drifting
From the English |air con(ditioning) or air con(ditioner)|: air conditioning or air conditioner
From the English |en(gine) sto(p)|: stall (as in an automobile engine)
From the American English |elevator|: elevator (American English), lift (British English)
From the English |ero(tic) + (b)log|: erotic / adult oriented blog
From the French |esthé(tique)|: beauty salon, esthetic clinic
From the English |fight|: often used to mean "Do your best!" or "I'll do my best"
From the English |fami(ly) com(puter)|: the Nintendo Entertainment System
From the German |fanfare|: a musical fanfare
From the English |fashion health|: a form of brothel
From the English |fetch|: (Computer Jargon) To fetch an instruction from main memory when a microprocessor executes a command
From the English |feti(sh)|: fetish (typically a sexual one but sometimes just referring to a distinctive preference)
From the English |four ball|: walk, base on, ball four
From the English |fly|: fly ball (baseball term)
From the English |fried potato|: french fries (US), chips (UK)
From the English |flying (start)|: premature start, breakaway
フリーダイアル or フリーダイヤル
From the English |free dial|: toll free call
From the English |front (desk)|: the reception desk, e.g. at a hotel or a sentō
From the English |front glass|: windshield (US), windscreen (UK)
From the English |guard man|: a (private) security guard, a person who directs traffic around work sites
From the Dutch or English |glas or glass|: glass (material)
From the English |gasoline stand|: gas station (US), petrol station (UK)
From the English |guts pose|: fist pump, victory pose
ゲームセンター or ゲーセン
From the English |game centre|: video arcade
From the German |Gelände (meaning 'site; ground; premises')|: ski slope
From the English |give (up)|: To give up
ギプス or ギブス
From the German |Gips|: cast (sometimes gipusu means a plaster cast, while gibusu refers to a plastic brace)
From the Dutch |gom|: rubber, eraser, rubber band
ゴールデンアワー or ゴールデンタイム
From the English |golden hour or golden time|: prime time in Japanese television
From the English |golden week|: A week of holidays in Japan, Golden Week.
From the English |gallery|: an art gallery, audience, or a pool of celebrities on a program.
From the English |high colla(r)|: In 1920s slang, it referred to a person who was devoted to Western fashions, trends and values
From the English |high neck|: A turtleneck style shirt or sweater
From the English |high touch|: High five
From the English |hacker|: refers specifically to a computer black hat
From the English |happy end|: a happy ending
From the English |hamburg(er steak)|: Salisbury steak, (culinary term)
From the English |handle|: steering wheel or bicycle handlebars
From the English |handle keeper|: designated driver
From the English |handle name|: handle, screen name
From the English |hun(ger) st(rike)|: hunger strike
From the English |(vinyl) + house|: greenhouse or glasshouse
From the English |hairpin curve|: hairpin turn
From the English |health meter|: bathroom scales, scales
From the German |Hysterie|: loss of (self) control
From the German |Hormon|: hormone; also offal when served for yakiniku or hotpot
From the English |Hotchkiss|: stapler (a genericized trademark of the E. H. Hotchkiss company, also used in Korea)
From the English |hotcake|: a pancake, (also called hotcake in English)
From the English |(plat)form|: a railway platform
From the English |White + Day|: White Day, a month after Valentine's Day
From the Portuguese and Spanish |inglês or inglés|: English, England or the United Kingdom
From the English |jumper|: jacket, jumper (Ski jumping athletes)
From the English |gender free|: gender equality, gender blind
From the English |jet coaster|: roller coaster
From the Mongolian |Genghis Khan|: Mongolian style barbecue with cut lamb and vegetables
From the English |juice|: often used to refer to soda or energy drinks, regardless of whether they contain any juice
From the Dutch |kan|: can (beverage can or tin can)
From the Japanese + English |空 (kara, empty) + orche(stra)|: karaoke
From the Portuguese |carta|: karuta (Japanese playing cards)
From the German |Karte|: (a patient's) medical record
From the Portuguese |(pão de) Castela (bread from Castile)|: a kind of sponge cake popular at festivals and as a street food
From the Russian |Katyusha|: Alice band; horseshoe-shaped hairband made of metal or plastic (often covered with cloth)
From the English |key holder|: key ring or key chain
From the English |kitchen paper|: paper towel
From the English |coin laundry|: laundromat (US), launderette (UK)
From the English |coin locker|: type of locker
From the English |comic + -alize|: to make a comic strip (manga) version of an originally non-comic strip title, like a movie
From the English |conveni(ence store)|: convenience store
From the French |concours|: a contest, a competition
From the English |concent(ric plug)|: power outlet
From the French |conte|: a short comedy
From the Portuguese |copo|: a glass or tumbler
From the English |croquette|: croquette, a small fried roll
From the English |cos(tume) play|: cosplay (dressing up in costumes, especially from manga, anime and video games)
From the English |Klaxon|: horn (on an automobile)
From the English |crystal|: shiny or clear
From the English |campaign|: a sales campaign or sweepstakes
From the French-made English |Camping-car|: a recreational vehicle
From the English |catch ball|: the game of catch
From the English |catch phone|: call waiting
From the English |Magic Ink (a registered trademark of Uchida Yoko Co., Ltd.)|: Permanent marker
From the English |mansion|: modern concrete apartment / condominium block
From the French |marron|: chestnut, metaphor for brown eyes
From the English |mass communication|: mass media, the media, the press
From the English |mother com(plex)|: Oedipus complex, or a strong attachment, formed in childhood, to one's mother, often used derogatorily; "girly man"
From the English |mail magazine|: e-mail newsletter, ezine
From the Portuguese |mirra (myrrh: an oil used in preservation)|: a mummy
From the English |milk|: milk, non-dairy creamer
From the English |(sewing) machine|: sewing machine
From the English |mobile|: mobile communications, mobile communications capability, or mobile communications devices, esp. PDAs and personal computers with wireless communications capabilities
From the English |mo(dern) bo(y)|: 1920s slang for young men adopting western styles and behaviours
From the English |mo(dern) gi(rl)|: 1920s slang for young women adopting western styles and behaviours, flapper
From the English |morning call|: wake-up call
From the English |morning coat|: morning coat
From the English |morning service|: breakfast special, complimentary toast, hard-boiled egg et al. that is served at some cafes when a cup of coffee is ordered
From the English |motel|: recently called as "love hotel". Does not have meaning of English "motel" used by tourists with their own vehicles.
From the English |night + -er|: a night game
ナンバーディスプレイ
From the English |number display|: caller ID
From the English |number plate|: BrE number plate, AmE license plate
From the Latin via German |Natrium|: sodium (Na)
From the English |Not in Employment, Education or Training|: underemployed young adults, akin to "フリーター"
ノークレームノーリターン
From the English |no claim, no return|: sold "as is"
From the Russian |норма (norma) (meaning 'standard; norm')|: quota, minimum requirement (tasks)
From the English |new-half|: A transgender individual that has undergone a sex change operation.
From the English |over|: overreaction to a situation or the end of a dating relationship
From the French |hors-d'œuvre (literally 'out of work')|: hors-d'œuvre
From the English |audience|: group of people who participate in a show
From the English |off|: a sale at a store; e.g., a "big summer off" (=big summer sale)

From the English |only one|: (adjective) one of a kind or unique; e.g., オンリーワン技術 (~gijutsu: "only one technology") or オンリーワン商品 (~shōhin: "only one products") meaning one of a kind technology or products
From the German |OP (short for Operation)|: surgical operation, minor surgery
From the English |a(ll) righ(t)|: all right, OK
From the Dutch |orgel|: a music box or any instrument that operates off of a music roll such as a calliope
From the English |auto bi(cycle)|: motorcycle, motorbike
パーソナルコンピューター
From the English |personal computer|: personal computer
From the Italian or Spanish |papà|: dad
From the Russian |печка (pechka) (meaning 'little oven')|: Russian oven
From the English |pair look|: matching outfits (usually between a couple)
From the French |pension|: a resort hotel / chalet / cottage
From the English |paper company|: dummy company, shell company
From the English |paper driver|: a person who has a driver's license but does not usually drive (i.e.: a driver only on paper)
From the English |paper test|: written examination/test
From the French |piment|: sweet bell pepper
From the German |(Eis)pickel (meaning 'ice axe')|: ice axe
From the English |(in a) pinch|: potentially disastrous situation
From the English and Spanish |poem + -er|: a poet
From the English |pocke(t) bell|: beeper, pager
From the French |pochette|: a small bag
From the English |post|: a mailbox (US), a postbox (UK)
From the English and Greek |plus alpha (in Greek: Άλφα) (a misreading of "+ X")|: in addition, a little bit more, with something else
From the English |plus driver|: Phillips screwdriver
From the English |play + guide|: (theater) ticket agency
From the English |Print Club (trademark)|: photo booth
From the English |professional|: describes a business professional or professional sports
From the English |pro(fessional) wrest(ling)|: professional wrestling
From the English |push phone|: touch-tone phone
From the English |love hotel|: love hotel (hotel used as a private place for couples to have sexual contact)
From the English |rival|: A fellow competitor or an enemy
From the English |live action|: animated or comic form stories made into TV shows/movies involving real actors, the opposite of komikarizu
From the English |live house|: club with live music, rock bar
From the Ainu |rakko|: a sea otter
From the English |lemona(de)|: Ramune (a lemon-lime soft drink; hard, powdery candy like Rockets or Smarties)
From the Dutch |ransel|: a hard schoolbag, worn on the back, carried by young children to school
ランニングホームラン
From the English |running home run|: an inside-the-park home run
From the English |running shirt|: a sleeveless T-shirt
From the French |résumé|: a resume, an outline
From the German |Röntgen|: X-ray, X-ray medical imaging
From the English |revenge|: return match, rematch, chance for redemption after a failed attempt
From the English |reach|: One step away from winning. Usually used in bingo.
リードオンリーメンバー
From the English |read-only member|: an internet lurker, thought to be a pun on "read-only memory"
From the English |reform|: remodel, renovation (as in a building)
From the English |remo(te) con(trol)|: remote control
From the English |link free|: free to link
From the English |recycle shop|: secondhand shop (slightly different from non-profit or charity thrift shops in that they are fundamentally for-profit and perceived as one way to help reduce trash)
From the English |roadshow (theatrical release)|: premiere, especially of a film
ロケーションハンティング, ロケハン
From the English |location hunting|: location scout
From the French |roman|: novel, something that rouses one's dreams / longings
From the English |romance grey|: silver-gray hair
From the English |romance car (first used as a trademark by the Odakyu Electric Railway)|: deluxe train
From the English |loss time|: added time, additional time
From the French |roux|: roux, most commonly used in describing the sauce of the popular dish, curry rice
From the English |service|: service, often used to describe something as being free of charge
From the English |side brake|: hand brake, parking brake, emergency brake
From the English |cider|: a kind of soda unrelated to actual cider
From the English |sign pen|: marker, Trade name of Pentel's
サンドイッチ or サンド
From the Portuguese or English |salada or salad|: salad
From the English |salaried man|: salaryman: a salaried office/white collar worker
From the English |se(x) + frie(nd)|: casual sexual partner
From the English |sex(ual) hara(ssment)|: sexual harassment
From the English |ceme(nt) dyne|: glue, adhesive. A genericized trademark of Cemedine Co., Ltd.
From the English |sense|: understanding of subtleties
From the English |celeb(rity)|: used to refer to a rich person, whether or not they are famous
シャープペンシル or シャーペン
From the English |shar(p) pencil or shar(p) pen(cil) (referring to Sharp Corporation, a manufacturer of mechanical pencils)|: mechanical pencil
From the English |C.M. (Commercial Message)|: television commercial
From the English |silver seat (referring to the silver hair of elderly passengers)|: priority seating on public transportation
From the English |soft(ware)|: software; also used to describe tasks or work (such as design) requiring imagination, foresight, and intuition
From the English |soft (ice) cream|: soft serve (ice cream)
From the English |solar system|: a solar battery
From the English |suite room|: a suite in a hotel
From the English |sky|: a bib, said to come from the name of an American clothing maker who sold bibs
From the English |ski|: used as a noun to refer to skiing
From the English |skin + -ship|: skinship (bonding through physical contact)
From the Dutch |schop|: trowel, spade, shovel
From the English |smart|: slim, stylish, well-dressed, cool, handsome
From the English |smooth (transaction)|: When a plan or transaction happens without incident
スパッツ, スパッツタイツ
From the English |spats, spats tights|: tights (US), leggings
From the English |spell|: used as a noun to mean "spelling"
From the English |spin|: a ribbon or tassel on a book
From the English |three size|: three primary female body measurements (bust, waist, hips)
ストライキ or スト
From the English |strike or st(rike)|: labor strike
From the English |straight tea|: black tea without milk or lemon
From the English |suits actor|: suit actor, an actor who performs wearing a cartoon-character costume
From the English |time over|: when a time limit has been reached
From the English |timely (hit)|: a clutch hit (in baseball), on time
From the English |towelket (towel + (blan)ket)|: a type of blanket made of a material similar to a bath towel
From the English |ten key|: numeric keypad
From the English |tension|: a state of excitement
From the English |televi(sion) game|: video game
From the English |tele(phone) ca(rd)|: prepaid card for using public telephones
From the English |Teenager|: A person in their teens
From the English |toile(t)|: toilet, bathroom, washroom, restroom
From the English |"ton," the on'yomi reading for 豚 (pork) + "katsu" from the English word "cutlet"|: pork cutlet
From the English |trouble|: (noun) (legal) trouble, a dispute or altercation; (verb) to encounter or experience trouble, to break down or not function as expected (e.g., a device)
From the English |trainer|: a sweat shirt
From the English |training pants|: pants for toddlers or babies; diaper
From the English |winker|: turn signal, a.k.a. blinker or indicator on an automobile
From the English |virgin road|: the aisle (in a Western-style or Christian wedding ceremony, as followed by the bridal procession)
From the English |Y shirt (modification of "white shirt")|: dress shirt (of any color)
From the English |one pattern|: uniformity or conformity, lacking of (spontaneous) variation. Used to describe behavior and responses as well as objects. Being "in a rut"
From the English |one piece|: (a single-piece) dress
From the English |wor(d) pro(cessor)|: word processor
From the English |washlet (wash+(toi)let)|: a toilet with a built-in bidet (a genericized trademark of TOTO Ltd.)
From the English |yacht|: a sailboat or yacht
From the English |youn(g) ex(ecutive)|: young executive
From the German |Jodtinktur|: tincture of iodine
From the English |unit bath|: modular bath, prefabricated bath
From the German |Seil (meaning 'rope')|: rope (used in a climbing context, in preference to the general term 'rōpu')
ゼミナール or ゼミ
From the German |Seminar or Semi(nar)|: seminar
From the French |jupon (meaning petticoat)|: trousers (British English), pants (American English)
